conclusion: Determine maximum force F to prevent block A from sliding relative to block B.
Block A is on top of Block B, which is on a horizontal surface. Force F is applied to Block B.
Mass of block A is 1kg, mass of block B is 2kg, maximum static friction between A and B is 1 N, coefficient of kinetic friction between B and ground is 0.1.
Calculate weight of block A: 10 N.
Calculate weight of block B: 20 N.
Calculate kinetic friction force on block B: 3 N.
For A and B to remain stationary, frictional force between A and B must prevent sliding.
Maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N.
Determine maximum acceleration of block A without sliding: 1 m/sÂ².
Apply Newton's Second Law to block B: F - 3 N = 3 N.
